definition: tree trunk/main part of sth/to manage/to work/to do/capable/cadre/to kill (slang)/to fuck (vulgar)

sentences.english: South Schisandra is singly small, flesh thin, looked withered, seeds there is no gloss rough.
sentences.chinese: 而南五味子粒小肉薄显干瘪，种子粗糙无光泽。

sentences.english: Dull and juiceless as only book knowledge can be when it is unrelated to…life.
sentences.chinese: 书本知识如果脱离生活则是干瘪的和无趣的。

sentences.english: I am only a poor peasant bishop.
sentences.chinese: 而我呢，只是一个干瘪瘪的乡下主教。

sentences.english: The hand looked chapped and wizened, not a boy's.
sentences.chinese: 那手看上去粗糙干瘪，不像是个男孩的手。

sentences.english: The man who renounces all looks dry.
sentences.chinese: 放弃一切的人看上去会很干瘪。

sentences.english: The greensward all wracked is, bents dried up and dead.
sentences.chinese: 草皮干瘪枯萎弯曲死掉。

sentences.english: And I touched his hand, and it became withered.
sentences.chinese: 并触碰了他的手，他的手便立刻干瘪了下去。

sentences.english: A dark stubble was shrouding his strong jaw and dimpled chin.
sentences.chinese: 硕大干瘪的下巴上满是黑黑的胡茬儿。

sentences.english: That wizened and grotesque little old man is a notorious miser.
sentences.chinese: 那个干瘪难看的小老头是个臭名远扬的吝啬鬼。

sentences.english: Your love is as deep as the ocean, but your pockets aren’t.
sentences.chinese: 你的爱深似海洋，可你的钱包却很干瘪。

sentences.english: The hand looked chapped and wizened.
The ancient and wizened tauren sat in front of the fire, warming his old bones.
sentences.chinese: 年迈干瘪的牛头人坐在火前，温暖着自己的老骨头。

sentences.english: My end is no regrets, the Iraqi people to wave.
sentences.chinese: 衣带渐宽终不悔，为伊消得人干瘪。

sentences.english: It is shrivelled and leather-like from the embalming process.
sentences.chinese: 经过药物保存处理的面部干瘪如皮革。

sentences.english: The towel gourds hanging on the wall have been dried out by the wind.
sentences.chinese: 墙上挂着的丝瓜都已经给风吹干瘪了。

definition: to be all skin and bones (idiom)/also written 皮包骨[pi2 bao1 gu3]
